Package com.game.myGame

Class Level1

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
com.game.myGame.Level
com.game.myGame.Level1
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Level1
extends Level
implements java.lang.Runnable
This class represents the first level of the game. It has a thread that runs and manages the animation. Here the keyboards control are set and also some statistics are stored.
Author:
MatteoValerio
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Level1

      public Level1​(GameFrame frame, java.lang.String name)
      Public constructor. It takes the frame that called him and a name.
      Parameters:
      frame - The GameFrame that invoked him
      name - The name of the level

  • Method Details

    • init

      private void init()
      Private method that initialize the game. It loads the audio, background and build the characters.

    • loadBackground

      private void loadBackground()
      Loads the background image for this level

    • addNotify

      public void addNotify()
      Overrides:
      addNotify in class javax.swing.JComponent

    • startLevel

      private void startLevel()
      Invoked to start the thread and the level

    • run

      public void run()
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable

    • initCharacters

      private void initCharacters()
      Initialize the characters, building the objects

    • startRender

      private void startRender()
      It displays the starting image for level 1

    • storeStats

      private void storeStats()
      Called to adjourn the timing statistics. When the seconds will reach 60 it will add 1 to the minutes and restart counting

    • gameRender

      private void gameRender()
      Invoked in the run() method. It creates a not visible screen for buffering the contents. After a check at the beginning, it will first paint the statistics, including the life of santa and of the enemy then it will paint santa, the enemy and all the bullets fired.

    • gameOverMessage

      private void gameOverMessage​(java.awt.Graphics2D dbg2, java.lang.String msg)
      Method called when the game is over: it can happen when you win or when you lose the level.
      Parameters:
      dbg2 - The graphics used to paint the message

    • paintScreen

      private void paintScreen()
      This method actively render the buffered image to the screen.

    • gameUpdate

      private void gameUpdate()
      This method updates all the sprites (movements variables..)

    • checkCollision

      private void checkCollision()
      This method checks if there are any collision between presents/wizard and fires/santa
